summary: This is a letter from the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) legal counsel regarding the case US v. Maxwell, submitted to Judge Nathan by an Assistant United States Attorney. The letter is not filed on ECF but the government has no objection to its public docketing.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Judge Nathan is the recipient of the letter from MDC counsel regarding the case US v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Mark S. Cohen is copied on the email correspondence regarding the letter from MDC counsel.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Christian Everdell is copied on the email correspondence regarding the letter from MDC counsel.

persons.name: Laura Mennin
persons.context: Laura Mennin is copied on the email correspondence regarding the letter from MDC counsel.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Jeff Pagliuca is copied on the email correspondence regarding the letter from MDC counsel.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a letter from MDC legal counsel regarding the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The letter is addressed to Judge Nathan and submitted by an Assistant United States Attorney.
The MDC is not a party to the case, so the letter was not filed on ECF, but the government has no objection to public docketing.
The correspondence involves multiple attorneys copied on the email: Mark S. Cohen, Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin, and Jeff Pagliuca.
The document date is January 25, 2021, indicating ongoing legal proceedings in the Maxwell case at that time.
